As an AI language model, I cannot predict the future, but it's possible that we might see a resurgence in the use of vintage instruments like the Mellotron in modern music. 

Many artists nowadays like to incorporate vintage instruments into their music to add a unique character and nostalgic feel. Vintage instruments like the Mellotron have a distinctive sound that cannot be emulated completely by modern synthesizers and software.

Moreover, the Mellotron has been used extensively in classic rock and psychedelic music, making it an iconic instrument of that era. Due to the cyclic nature of music trends, it's possible that the Mellotron and other vintage instruments may become fashionable again in popular music.

In addition, there has been a resurgence in the use of analog recording techniques and other vintage equipment, which could lead to a renewed interest in vintage instruments like the Mellotron. The resurgence of vinyl records also indicates a renewed interest in retro and vintage aesthetics.

So, it's possible that the Mellotron and other vintage instruments may make a comeback in modern music, as artists continue to seek new ways to create unique sounds and styles in their compositions.
